title: German defense firm partners with Iceye to build SAR satellites
summary:
German defense contractor Rheinmetall plans to start building synthetic aperture radar satellites next year with Finnish SAR constellation operator Iceye, amid Europe’s broader push to bolster military intelligence capabilities.

summary:

title: NASA Astronaut Anne McClain Works on Space Station
summary: In this May 1, 2025, photo taken by fellow NASA astronaut Nichole Ayers, Anne McClain works near one of the International Space Station’s main solar arrays during a spacewalk. title: NASA Earns Two Emmy Nominations for 2024 Total Solar Eclipse Coverage
summary: NASA’s coverage of the April 8, 2024, total solar eclipse has earned two nominations for the 46th Annual News & Documentary Emmy Awards. The Academy of Television Arts & Sciences announced the nominations on May 1, recognizing NASA’s outstanding work in sharing this rare celestial event with audiences around the world. title: NASA Telescopes Tune Into a Black Hole Prelude, Fugue
summary: NASA released three new pieces of cosmic sound Thursday that are associated with the densest and darkest members of our universe: black holes. These scientific productions are sonifications — or translations into sound — of data collected by NASA telescopes in space including the Chandra X-ray Observatory, James Webb Space Telescope, and Imaging X-ray Polarimetry […]

title: ESA and India Agree to Cooperate on Human Spaceflight
summary:
The European Space Agency and the Indian Space Research Organisation have signed a joint statement of intent to collaborate on human spaceflight. The move comes just days after the United States proposed scaling back its own human spaceflight cooperation with Europe. On 7 May, ESA announced the signing of the agreement, stating that the cooperation […]
